data.message: Just reported this post as offensive

replies.message: Wow, very mature. In case you couldn't tell, my comment was oozing with sarcasm.
Actually Amber, I reported the picture, not a comment.

And for the record, Facebook has violated its own terms of usage.  

In the 'Community Standards' section of its terms of usage, it defines Hate Speech as the following:
Facebook does not permit hate speech, but distinguishes between serious and humorous speech. While we encourage you to challenge ideas, institutions, events, and practices, we do not permit individuals or groups to attack others based on their race, ethnicity, national origin, religion, sex, gender, sexual orientation, disability or medical condition.

In taking a position, it has come directly after certain Facebook users based on at least TWO of these criteria.  To make matters worse, even if the development team could justify that it was not an attack per se, the door was opened, via this post, to enable (or even encourage) others to violate these terms and conditions.  If nothing else, they've taken a side in this discourse in an irresponsible manner.
its not a hate speech :) its a fact. deal with it. dont be a butthurt.
Well, Facebook won't monitor their own posts!
